results.title: New Caledonia: a land in search of itself
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Oliver Howes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
The issue of maintaining a balance between the traditional cultures and western world influences is central to this series that examines the different islands of the Pacific. This particular program looks at French New Caledonia and we see how the Kanaks are determined to maintain their Melanesian heritage regardless of politics and alien cultural influences. This documentary is really about the tension between the original Kanak inhabitants of this Pacific Island and the French colonialist settlers that were coming to a head in the early 1980s with a movement towards independence from France.

results.title: New Caledonia
results.brief_description: Seven hundred miles east of the Australian coast lies the French island possession of New Caledonia. The capital Noumea, is a pleasant tropical town with modern shops and Parisian street cafes, native markets and wide beaches. The island is rich in high-grade nickel ore, and in the mountains inland from Noumea the ore is mined and conveyed in an aerial conveyor to smelting works on the coast, where the nickel is extracted and exported. From the series “Pacific on parade”.

results.creator_credit: David Adams, Pyramid Films, Bob Berk and Frank Gardonyi
results.brief_description: Revised version of Film no 505488. Shows first aid techniques to use when people are choking. Notes the methods of opening the airway, dislodging foreign objects, and mouth-to-mouth breathing.

results.title: New breath of life
results.brief_description: Shows new methods for opening the airway and relieving choking and obstruction by the tongue during unconsciousness. Follows latest recommendations of the National Research Council. American Heart Association and American Red Cross. Provides instruction in performing artificial respiration.

results.title: New bicycle
results.creator_credit: U E V A and Jack Lieberman
results.brief_description: Uses the purchasing of a new bicycle to illustrate the entire purchasing process, including the computerised ordering at the store, operations at the steel mill and on the assembly line, and the transportation of the finished product.

results.title: New beginnings
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Stella Paraskakis
results.brief_description: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.

results.title: New arts
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Eric Saarinen and Howard Chesley
results.brief_description: Surveys the creations and thoughts of eight artists whose work combines art and technology and shows the installations of some of these art works. Refers to Boyd Mefferd, Claes Oldenberg, Newton Harrison, Robert Whitman, Roy Lichtenstein, Andy Warhol, Tony Smith, and Rockne Krebs.

results.title: Neville Mendham: agronomist
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Joe Scully
results.brief_description: The territory of Papua New Guinea offers many opportunities for technicians in all branches of science. In this film, the first of a series to be made about this general subject, the man studied is a agronomist working in a developing society and a land of great promise, on a project to develop an oil palm industry.
